alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 04 at 1:46PM MDT until September 04 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING IN THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Very dry air is moving into the area on strong southwest winds today. Critical fire weather conditions will continue this afternoon with above normal temperatures in the low to mid 90s. Winds will taper off around sunset as temperatures cool and humidity rises. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) through 7 PM MDT today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...12 to 17% * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
